Class BasePage

java.lang.Object
application.framework.BasePage
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddTrustedReviewerPage, AdminHomePage, AdminSetupPage, AdminUserModifyPage, AdminUserPage, FirstPage, InstructorHomePage, InvitationPage, PrivateMessageConvoPage, PrivateMessagePage, ReplyList, ResetPasswordPage, ReviewerHomePage, SetPassPage, SetupAccountPage, SetupLoginSelectionPage, TrustedReviewerPage, UserHomePage, UserLoginPage, UserQuestionDisplay, WelcomeLoginPage
public abstract class BasePage extends Object
Base class for all pages in the application.

This class minimizes JavaFX boilerplate code and provides a protected AppContext instance for performing database operations. It handles basic scene setup and layout management.

Author:
Dhruv

  • Field Details

    • context

      protected final AppContext context
      The AppContext instance provides access to the application context.

      It is used for interacting with various application components like repositories, the session, and the router, enabling database operations and navigation within the app.

      See Also:
      • AppContext

    • stage

      private javafx.stage.Stage stage

  • Constructor Details

    • BasePage

      public BasePage()
      Initializes the base page and the app context.

      It retrieves the singleton instance of AppContext to provide access to the application context.

      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if AppContext fails to initialize

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Initializes the page by setting the stage.

      This method is called by the PageRouter after the page is constructed.

      Parameters:
      stage - The primary stage for the page.

    • createView

      public abstract javafx.scene.layout.Pane createView()
      Abstract method that subclasses must override to build their UI layout.

      Subclasses should define how their specific view layout will be constructed.

      Returns:
      The root pane for the page's layout.

    • show

      public void show()
      Displays the page by setting up the scene and showing the stage.

      This method sets the scene, title, size, and visibility for the page.

    • getStage

      public javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      Returns the stage for the page.
      Returns:
      The Stage associated with the page.

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns the title of the page, either from the View annotation or default value.
      Returns:
      The title of the page.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the page, either from the View annotation or default value.
      Returns:
      The width of the page.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the page, either from the View annotation or default value.
      Returns:
      The height of the page.

    • isResizable

      public boolean isResizable()
      Returns whether the page is resizable, either from the View annotation or default value.
      Returns:
      true if the page is resizable, false otherwise.
